intro: Brachystephium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a basal rosette, while the flowers consist of ray florets and disk florets. Brachystephium species often thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
